measurement-title: How we measure inclusivity in a line of foundations
methods-box: We took color samples from the product pages of the beauty brand‚Äôs website.
Using Photoshop, we extracted the lightness values (using the CIE Lab color model).
We plotted these lightness values on a histogram, which shows us whether a foundation line caters towards lighter or darker skin tones (see below).

part1-graphic-legend: Winner = more shades in this lightness range

steps-part1.text: Both Fenty‚Äôs PRO FILT‚ÄôR and Make Up For Ever‚Äôs Ultra HD foundation do, in fact, offer 40 different shades. But how diverse are those colors? By extracting the lightness value of the color swatches on each brand‚Äôs website, we can get a better idea of whether their shades are evenly distributed or cater to either light or dark shades.
When we group each brand‚Äôs shades by their lightness values, we can start to see the distribution of the 40 shades.
Now we can compare the number of shades each brand offers in each lightness range to see where Fenty and Make Up For Ever each shine.
Fenty‚Äôs Pro Filt‚Äôr foundation has much more even support for all types of skin tones, and excels in representing people on both the darkest and lightest ends of the spectrum.
In contrast, 31 of Make Up For Ever‚Äôs 40 shades fall in the 60 - 90 lightness range, primarily catering to light and tanned skin tones.

part1-2-disclaimer-text: Our measurements are only a rough proxy for inclusivity ‚Äì how a liquid foundation changes when it‚Äôs applied to our faces, whether it‚Äôs effective across different hues/undertones, and how it looks after a day of wear are all factors we were unable to account for.
